title: 115_hr2105
content: The Act may be cited as the "NIST Small Business Cybersecurity Act" and aims to improve cybersecurity for small businesses. The "NIST Small Business Cybersecurity Act" defines key terms like Director, resources, and small business concern. It amends the National Institute of Standards and Technology Act to include considerations for small business concerns in cybersecurity. The Director, in consultation with other Federal agencies, will disseminate resources to help small businesses identify and manage cybersecurity risks within one year of the Act's enactment. The resources must be applicable and usable by a wide range of small businesses. The resources disseminated to help small businesses manage cybersecurity risks must be applicable to a wide range of small businesses, vary based on the implementing concern's size and data sensitivity, promote basic controls and cybersecurity culture, include practical case studies, and be technology-neutral. The Director ensures resources for small businesses managing cybersecurity risks are technology-neutral, based on international standards, and consistent with relevant legislation. Additionally, the Director aligns efforts with the Cybersecurity Enhancement Act and considers strategies from the Small Business Development Center Cyber Strategy. The Director ensures that resources for small businesses managing cybersecurity risks are technology-neutral, based on international standards, and consistent with relevant legislation. The resources disseminated under section 1841(a)(3)(B) of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2017 are considered voluntary. The Director reviews and updates these resources as necessary, with information about them being made publicly available on agency websites in a consistent, clear, and concise manner. The Act does not override federal cybersecurity requirements for agencies and will be funded using existing funds allocated to the National Institute of Standards and Technology. The House of Representatives passed the Act on October 11, 2017.
